title: Killingsworth shooting: Lonzo D. Murphy, 22, arrested in connection with shooting outside school
content:
Police arrested a 22-year-old man early Saturday morning in connection with the Friday afternoon shooting that injured four people outside Rosemary Anderson High School.
Gang enforcement Det. Brian Sims made the arrest of 22-year-old Lonzo Deshawn Murphy. Murphy was booked into the downtown Portland jail at 6:27 am Saturday.
Murphy is being held without bail on a parole violation for a 2013 robbery conviction.
The 22-year-old was arrested in a car at North Interstate Avenue and Going Street at 1:30 a.m. A handgun was seized during the arrest.
Police spokesman Sgt. Pete Simpson said members of the bureau's special emergency response team served a search warrant at 1:30 a.m. at an apartment in the 200 block of North Killingsworth Street as part of the investigation. The apartment is just 5 blocks east of where the shooting took place just after noon Friday at the alternative high school.
According to court records, Murphy pleaded no contest to one count of second-degree robbery and one count of third-degree assault in June 2013.
Murphy was also convicted of interfering with public transportation and theft of services on Nov. 29, 2012, according to court records. He was sentenced to bench probation and ordered to complete an anger-management course.
Records show that Murphy also violated his probation in June 2013.
Police are asking anyone with information about the shooting to contact Det. Brad Clifton at 503-823-2087, or via email, brad.clifton@portlandoregon.gov; or Det. Todd Gradwahl at 503-823-2056, or via email todd.gradwahl@portlandoregon.gov.
-- Stuart Tomlinson
